DOC.brief_summary: OBJECTIVES : To evaluate effect cost-utility positional therapy compare sleep position trainer ( SPT ) continuous positive airway pressure ( CPAP ) , mandibular reposition appliance ( MRA ) combination SPT MRA patient moderate positional obstructive sleep apnea ( POSA ) . HYPOTHESIS : The SPT cost-effective effective , mean reduction apnea-hypopnea index ( AHI ) , quality life compliance , compare CPAP MRA . STUDY DESIGN : A multicenter randomize clinical trial ( RCT ) perform follow-up 12 month per patient . Patients randomized CPAP , MRA , SPT combination SPT MRA . All outcome measure baseline , month 3 , 6 12 . STUDY POPULATION : Patients diagnose moderate POSA accord polysomnography ( PSG ) result . INTERVENTION / STANDARD INTERVENTION TO BE COMPARED TO : The SPT train POSA patient sleep non-supine position , CPAP use positive airway pressure open airway ; MRA intra-oral prosthesis , hold mandible protrusive position , prevent effectively apneic event . OUTCOME MEASURES : AHI , compliance , quality-adjusted life year ( QALY ) , direct indirect cost , cardiovascular parameter , incremental cost-effectiveness ratio ( ICER ) SAMPLE SIZE / DATA ANALYSIS : 100 subject treatment group , total 400 patient . COST-EFFECTIVENESS ANALYSIS / BUDGET IMPACT ANALYSIS : The SPT expect improve cost-effectiveness overall treatment POSA patient , save annually approximately 35-150 million euro .
